ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Learned a lot about the intersection between law and technology. This course covered a wide selection of topics and thoughtfully curated content.
Great insight into how technology affects policy and our daily lives. Especially the course material engages in a lot of up to date technology, which was nice.
Learned about how technology and the Internet have impacted international and domestic politics
I absolutely loved the insight that we got into the world of technology and politics. It was a brilliantly taught course with many fantastic guest speakers.
An understanding of the outlines of current problems in cybersecurity and cyberpolitics.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The readings were fantastic and insightful and the lectures always went in depth and covered a variety of perspectives on the issues. In terms of improvement, as this is a joint PLSC CS class, I thought more could be done to encourage cross talk and collaboration between the students in each section. Other than that, fantastic course!
The strengths were that they had two faculties from two disciplines, weakness was that the Polisci portion of the class was almost like a book review of our readings at times.

The material of this course is very interesting and Professor Acorn does a really good job presenting in during lecture. The weakness is that it is co-taught with a section in computer science. The more technical lectures were really interesting, but there were some lectures where I wished that the class was separated by section so we could talk more about the political implications rather than the tech.

I think that the grading wasn't ideal since the computer science and humanities sections were graded on the same scale. Apart from that, the many guest speakers made the course very enjoyable and memorable.
The course was very superficial at times. The assignments did not require me to think very hard and did not require mastery of the material.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes. If youre a political science student interested in technology topics, this is the course for you. Would highly recommend.
Yes, if you are interested in more of the applications of new technology, especially involving the Internet, and also if you care about data privacy.
If you're interested in technology and politics, yes because the course material is really interesting. Otherwise, no because it isn't well organized right now.
I would certainly recommend this course to another student. It is a great combination of computer science and politics.
I would not tell a student unusually interested in these topics not to take the course, but I would not recommend it in general.
